article_title: Yankees Will Let Masahiro Tanaka Use All His Pitches
article_text:
When Masahiro Tanaka takes the mound Friday for his major league debut, the eyes of the baseball world will be on him. His vaunted split-finger fastball was the talk of the spring Grapefruit Leaue, and as the Blue Jays will find out, he's got six more pitches to go with it—that is, if the Yankees allow him to bring all of them north.

It's not unusual for starting pitchers in Japan's Nippon Professional Baseball league to throw five or six different pitches, where pitchers in Major League Baseball typically have just four,...

twitter.description: The former Rakuten Golden Eagles ace with the $155 million contract is bringing no fewer than seven different pitches to the American League.
twitter.title: Does Tanaka Need His Whole Arsenal of Pitches?
